Here is a ready-to-use, editable reminder template you can copy into a notes document and customize. It supports three reminders around 9:30 AM, 1:30 PM, and 8:00 PM with a snooze option (10–15 minutes) or skip, plus a pause option for busy days. Each reminder prompts hunger rating (0–10), what you’re feeling, triggers around you, and the next micro-step (start with 5-4-3-2-1 grounding if cravings arise; otherwise do the 60-second body scan with an optional 60 seconds of light movement). It also includes a cooling-safe-snack list, a simple slip/reset protocol, and an adjustment plan for weather/heat/stress. You can copy and paste, then tailor times, prompts, and snacks as needed.

Reminders
- Times: 9:30 AM, 1:30 PM, 8:00 PM
- Snooze: 10–15 minutes
- Skip: allowed
- Pause reminders: yes (pause for a chosen duration; resume manually or at the next scheduled time)

Prompts per reminder
1) Hunger rating (0–10)
2) What you’re feeling
3) Triggers around you
4) Next micro-step: 5-4-3-2-1 grounding OR 60-second body scan + optionally 60 seconds of light movement

Safe snacks (cooling options to keep handy)
- Apple slices, grapes, cucumber, yogurt, berries, etc. customize as you like

Logging fields
- Timestamp, hunger rating, mood/feeling, triggers noted, snack chosen (if any), how you felt after, next step chosen, any notes

Slip protocol
- Acknowledge
- Note triggers
- Reset with steps 1–3 (grounding, body scan, movement)

Adjustment plan (weather/heat/stress)
- If needed, shift reminder times by up to ±15 minutes, swap snacks, or simplify prompts

Pause reminders
- How to pause: set a duration (e.g., 1–3 days or specific hours) and resume automatically or manually when ready

Would you like me to generate a version formatted for Google Calendar/Reminders or a plain text file you can save and reuse?
